title: Riot's 'automated systems' can now ban your account permanently, and it makes mistakes.
body:
So this happened to me.
this Monday,I was playing All-in-one all day long, welp, I did play some ranked but 3 loses in a row so I gave up.
Next day in the morning, I read two emails from Riot, both stating that my account has been banned permanently due to 'the use of malicious 3rd party programs'.
Please don't tell me that 'OP you sucky cheater, you deserved it' because firstly I wouldn't complain a single word for getting banned if I did anything wrong or used any forms of scripts. Secondly, check my match history here, i was playing ALL-IN-ONE (mostly in custom games) and Sona support in ranked. I highly doubt any scripts would have promoted the gameplay.
So I thought, this is some kind of mistake, all i have to do is opening a support ticket and they'll fix this easily.
And I did, and they replied very fast.

> Your account has been permanently suspended following the use of scripts, hacks, exploits or unauthorized third-party programs in League of Legends. Accounts that are caught using hacks to gain an unfair competitive advantage are subject to permanent suspension. We work hard to preserve a fair and competitive environment in League of Legends. Regardless of intent, use of unauthorized third-party programs is explicitly against the Terms of Use, which can be found here:
>
> NA: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/legal/termsofuse 
> EUW: http://euw.leagueoflegends.com/legal/termsofuse 
> EUNE: http://eune.leagueoflegends.com/legal/termsofuse 
> OCE: http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/legal/termsofuse 
>
> Keep in mind that account sharing of any kind is also against the Terms of Use. You are responsible for all activity on your account, so be sure to keep your account information to yourself.
>
> We won't be able to go into the specifics of an account's exploit abuse, as divulging this information could compromise future investigations. Let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Tell me what you smell from this? I smell bureaucracy, dictatorship, and arbitrary. I bet this guy didn't even closely look at what I wrote in that ticket. I cannot self-prove innocence for this sick reason so I asked them to 'double check the data they collected and unlock my account immediately,' Obviously they did not. But I did closely looked their Term of Use, which has been modified recently.
Article 2.1.2 says this:

> 2.1.2. Us.We may terminate or suspend your account if we determine, in our sole discretion, that:
> (a) you have violated any part of this Agreement;
> (b) we have stopped offering the Riot Services in your region; or
> (c) doing so would be in the best interests of our community, the Riot Services, or the rights of a third party.
> We may make such determinations, among other ways, by using automated systems and machine learning tools.

The last sentence is the highlight. 'Automated systems and machine learning tools' can now banned our accounts, permanently. Considering the two email regarding my ban was received on June 20 2016 10:50 PM MST, which was shortly after my last game that day, I highly doubt my ban was done by a human.
So I replied immediately, with anger, that I refuse to accept punishment for wrongdoing that I did not do. I replied on Tuesday around 1 pm and it has been more than 55 hours since I opened the ticket. Not a single action has been taken by Riot games.
Only I got another reply yesterday.

> We have a Player Behavior team in place dedicated to working with these requests, so I need to transfer your ticket. A Player Behavior Specialist will be contacting you as soon as they can.
>
> Please keep in mind that we respond to tickets in the order we receive them, so ‘bumping’ your ticket by sending us additional messages will send it to the back of our queue. This might inadvertently delay our response :(

This sounds like they're doing something about it. To make myself clear, I replied with

> Let me make the situation more clear.
> ----------------------------------------------------
> 1. I did not use hacks, cheats, scripts of any kind, nor did I intentionally modify my client. Otherwise I wouldn't be opening this ticket.
>
> 2. Something weird did happen on my client right before the ban (as a described earlier). I have no idea what was going on but I didn't pay much attention to it as client crashes, bugging out and server lags are not uncommon. It is your responsibility to investigate and solve software design flaws and bugs.
>
> 3. I am requesting you to carefully review my case because I believe it is a mistake. As stated in your term of use, a ban can be initiated by automated system.
>
> 4. As an user of yours, especially a paid user, I believe I should be treated fairly and justly, without arbitrary and unconcern.

As of now, no reply, account still banned.
All I'm asking is a simple thing, that clearly something went wrong and I want them to find out what went wrong, fix it, and make sure It'll never happen again. And I have been asking this repeatedly.
It took one microsecond for their 'automated systems' to ban my account and I have no idea how many days are they gonna take to fix.
It is also possible that they'll never admit that they did something wrong. Probably a single user means nothing to them while they're taking dollars from millions of.
Either way, I'll keep this post updated.

If you got banned for scripting, you were scripting. In the old days pendragon and wookiecookie used to come to the old forums and personally answer ban questions. In the 6 years I've been playing this game only 1 ban was ever a mistake. The guy insulted himself in /all chat and the system caught him. Everyone banned for 3rd party apps were later found to be using things like mkjogo, or curse voice (during the short period of time between riot clarifying the rules for 3rd party apps and curse changing the program to follow those rules), or actual scripts and hacks.

And to be completely frank with you, you're an idiot if you think ANYTHING could give enough false flags to get you banned for scripting. The program injects itself into the league client. That alone causes the first flag. Next flag is if the program is using anything that riot has already identified as a scripting program. If nothing like that is found, it analyzes packets sent from your client. If there are any malformed packets, or an abnormally high number of packets, thats another flag. Mouse movements and mouse clicks are taken into account too. If your mouse right clicks exactly every 50ms instead of being completely random like an actual human, thats another flag. If you're sending conflicting movement commands (like what would happen if you wanted to move one direction but your evade script pushed you the other way) thats another flag.

This isn't like a drug test. They aren't looking for one specific chemical which can be false flagged by taking an ibuprofen. If they say you're scripting, I believe them until they come in here and say this is the first false positive for scripting in the history of LoL.

That's just not true.  

I've seen multiple bans overturned on both the old forums and even here on the Boards.  

"Riot says you did it, therefore you did" is just the penultimate level of fanaticism on these Boards.  False positives happen.  Sure, more than likely the OP used a third party modification, but to make such a claim that there aren't mistakes is, quite candidly, bullshit.  You're putting way too much faith in Riot and that's just foolhardy.

Link one case of a scripting ban being overturned. I've already mentioned the only example of a mistaken ban I've ever seen, and it had nothing to do with scripting. If I'm mistaken _on this point_ great, I'd love to read that case.

Regardless you seem to have overlooked the entire middle paragraph, which takes up the majority of that comment. Detecting scripting is not like a drug test. You won't get a false positive just because you took an ibuprofin before pissing in the cup. One flag (a program injecting) leads to a second check (whether its a known permitted 3rd party program or not), which leads to a 3rd check (any markers, files, or packets that are confirmed to be part of scripting software), and finally, a plethora of other possible flags (malformed packets, high volume of packets, an action every 50ms exactly, actions occuring with less delay than expected, conflicting movement signals). 

Its not ONE thing they check that can cause you to be banned because you have "this one weird program that uses this one weird file that is associated with scripting, but its totally not a scripting program." The system looks for tons of different data points to determine if you're cheating or not. If you somehow managed to cause a false positive I wanna see your system. If you didn't intentionally write a program to cause a false positive, you got some weird shit going on in your computer.
